data.text: Standard Operating Procedure for Preparation of Influenza (flu) Vaccine syringes for Administration
This SOP describes the process for preparation of ready to administer syringes of influenza (flu) Vaccine.
This procedure covers the process from the removal of syringes of flu vaccine from the fridge until the point of administration. This includes how many syringes to take out at a time.
Staff performing any stage of the preparation of flu vaccine are responsible for following this procedure.

The Chief Pharmacist must ensure that appropriate and formal authorisation for vaccine administration is in place such as a Patient Group Direction, protocol or written instruction/prescription, and that the staff groups who are supplied with, prepare, and administer the vaccine are those defined as eligible to do so.
When working in pairs, it is the responsibility of both authorised persons to observe all local COVID-19 precautions.
Removal of vaccines from fridge

4.1.1 Remove the required number of flu Vaccine syringes, from the fridge To prevent waste, the number of syringes removed should be enough to cover no more than approximately 1 hour of anticipated usage (up to a maximum of syringes) per member of staff administering the vaccine.
If there is more than one flu vaccine in the fridge, use the one with the shortest post-thaw expiry date. One syringe contains sufficient vaccine to administer 1 dose.
4.1.2 Place the required number of flu syringes into a clean blue tray.
4.1.3 Transport the blue tray to the vaccination preparation area.
Vaccination preparation area
4.2.1 Confirm the vaccination preparation area is clear and free from any other vaccines.
4.2.2 Ensure a yellow lidded sharps bin with sufficient free capacity is available.
4.2.3 Put on an apron
Clean preparation area with a decontaminant wipe and discard into a clinical waste bin.

4.2.4 Hands must be sanitised in accordance with the site policy for hand hygiene (or equivalent) immediately prior to preparation of the injectable medicine. Gloves must only be donned in accordance with the site policy for infection control standard precautions (or equivalent), before the injectable is assembled.
4.2.5 Administer the flu vaccine
4.2.6 Once empty, or no longer needed, immediately discard the used flu syringe into a yellow lidded sharps bin.
4.2.7 Empty outer cartons can be disposed of in normal waste.
